comments.commentBody: Mr. MacCash, I don't know the phrase "up-East." But in New England, if you're traveling to and through Maine, it's called, "Down East."

This is outrageous. Zabar's was famous, and the quality and authenticity of its offerings were respected. How could he do this - after his store was so favored by so many for so many years? I feel a little betrayed and saddened by it.

Since Saul Zabar appears to rely on Wikipedia for information, did he ever read their definition of the word "fraud." If not, he and other like-minded business people should. The problem is all to common in our society.

Open your eyes people, where've you been? Beloved Zabar's is only one of a million stores that do the same thing. Look in any major supermarket or Costco/BJ deli or the like, and you'll find various painted fish like substitutes masquerading for fake crabs and lobsters everywhere. Some of it has a bright red section to imitate the cooked reddish color you'd see on a normal crustacean. I don't know what that imitation color is, but I won't go near it again.

I grew up on Cape Cod, and was stunned when I first took a bite of this psuedo-seafood in NY & NJ. It tastes nothing like the real thing. I haven't touched it since. If it's not alive, kicking, and in its birth shell, I don't get it any more. Fraud? Damn right it is. Get mad, but get mad at all, not just Zabar. And then, let's get busy and get it off the shelves.

Thank you, Mr. MacCash, for exposing Zabar's fraud. Because Zabar's is a New York institution does not give it the right to deceive and cheat its customers. But, then, perhaps Mr. Zabar thought he could get away with the fraud because he, like I have, probably noticed that many of his customers would buy dog doodoo if it had a Zabar's label on it. Meanwhile, it appears that Whole Foods has taken a page from Zabar's "let's get the customer" book.

Lessons: Stay away from Zabar's and Whole Foods, read labels and call out stores who try to put one over on their trusting customers.
If anyone wonders where the great Seinfeld writers got their material, it is right here.  Totally hilarious.

While reading this flim-flam stuff, I thought of what we here in California experience of a like nature...

California Lobsters are Pacific crayfish with no claws, or perhaps very small ones... In the super-markets, Maine lobsters are high-priced, as are small lobster tails from other countries... All have been frozen and thawed...

But what bothers me is that our supermarkets put meats out as Manager's-Specials... Every time, (every time), I buy a package of those meats, I get sick... Not real sick, but sick, you know what I mean...

An old golfing partner who sold pork products to supermarkets told me hair raising tales of how tainted meats were treated before being sold to the public... The bleach soak was one... sick sick sick///

When a truck with meat inside is in an accident and the cooler gets shut off, time becomes a critical factor... Meat sales are discounted to supermarket owners when this occurs, and of course the process of delivery to point of sales is speeded up, in various ways, Manager's Specials being only one of many ways...

Safeguards, hah!!! Government is too busy making war...

Seems like a fair price for a tasty product. "A rose by any other name".
I remember lobster rolls for 50cents along the roads in Maine.

I don't think some people grasped that the price difference between those two items was "with a roll or bagel" for the smaller 4oz portion, so they're actually making far more $ by you purchasing half bagel, half salad at $15.60... makes the bagel, if it's 4oz (average bagel size), $14.25/lb. That, my friends, is where the REAL ripoff is!
Mr. Zabar's explanation is ridiculous. I won't knowingly patronize the business of a liar.

...Bart officials told the SF Appeal, an online paper, that it was well within its rights. After all, since it pays for the cell service underground, it can cut it off...

Who gives Bart the money to pay for the cell service underground? Users and taxpayers. It's not Bart's. They are entrusted with our money to provide a service. Expecting them to abide by the First Amendment is reasonable. Expediency overcame common sense and rule of law. Perhaps a few people at Bart need to experience the same expediency regarding their replacement.

The best "stimulus" plan is to shrink the share of the economy confiscated by the government through high taxes, leave those funds in the hands of those who earn it and let them spend it how they see fit. That's the only reliable way to create jobs and increase demand. Taking money from Mr. and Mrs. taxpayer, filtering it through an inefficient and politicized bureaucracy and returning a much smaller amount to them is a recipe for the kind of sick economy we have now.

Republican economic theory: "I've got mine."

This is not a basis on which to craft policy for 312 million people.

Can't you see that these fruitcakes are trying to precipitate an apocalypse to force God to show that it exists? They're in the same class as the Egyptair relief pilot who crashed a planeload of passengers (Flight 990) into the mid-Atlantic, chanting "I put my faith in God" as he pleaded for divine intervention?

Jay Leno got it right several years ago. There's one tax we can ALL agree on: The Other Guy Tax! Such squabbling and belittling of opposing views. There's little real discussion and even less analysis. Polarization means the two extremes demonize each other and that's what we've got.

Personally, I look forward to the triggers cutting the military budget. The US spends more on the military than the rest of the entire world spends on their military combined!!! That's more than wasteful, it's mind boggling

Ask one question: Who lines the pockets of Grover Norquist?

I believe that answer will enlighten many.

Our two party system continues to deteriorate as the parties lose their identities. Republicans favoring stimulus program (of course we would have to borrow or print the money) is hypocrisy. On the other hand tonight on PBS they mentioned President Obama can't discuss the deal he tied to cut with John Boehner because it slashes social programs.

We need a viable third party.

Sadly, an outcome is how Rep Boehner chooses to come to grips with the historical record.  At a time when the country might have been put on a clear path to recovery through the "Grand Bargain", he walked away from the opportunity in order to curry favor with the extreme right fringe of his party.  Where was the wisdom, courage and leadership he had shown in the past, and that we needed from the Speaker of the House at so critical an hour?

All the repukes seem to forget where the state would be with the federal govt. Rick Perry can brag all he wants about have a balance budget but when they get 37% of funding for the federal govt, his balance budget is balance on the backs of the federal govt and every other state.
I have absolutely no confidence in the Republican's economics. Lesson learned.

...Just to emphasize, the last line is a killer, "Institutionalizing such a program would also require establishing a “funding fast lane” to offset DOD’s “general inability to be agile” as a result of the elaborate requirements process used in formal acquisition programs, Carter said. Congress is turning their heads the other way by agreeing to get rid of the, "...elaborate requirements process used in formal acquisition programs." This will pass most Americans by as they focus on just managing their lives. A military/intel coup took place against America starting in the 1950's and has continued, while America sleeps.

All these criticisms won't make any difference to the suicidal terrorists ("We are not worried about reelection"!). And there is no negotiating with the terrorists as Obama has learned by now, I hope. Given that Democrats have no backbone to stand up to them, the only thing that will work is to get rid of the suicidal Tea Partiers, and that is up to us people in 2012.

Defensive attitudes signal a feeling of guilt.
They ought to feel guilty.
They are doing their best to destroy the nation.
I don't know how they face a mirror each morning.
All they see is a reflection of amoral, greedy hypocrisy.
If they can't see that, they are shells of selves.
The only pledge any member of Congress should ever take is to protect and defend the Constitution of the United States.

I suppose this is an effort to build the case that the Republican party has moved to the right, though a pretty transparent one.  "Analysts question  ___X___"?  Analysts question everything, that's why they're called "analysts."  If 10 Republican "analysts" think we should have more stimulus, why are the Republican voters still pulling to the right?  I guess they are just not as smart as Republican analysts.
